title: Social media in the 2020 United States presidential election
deleted: Various disinformation campaigns related to the 2020 United States presidential election are circulating on social media. The [[Anti-Defamation League]] reports that "numerous examples of violent rhetoric and warnings about a coup, civil war, or other attempts to steal the election can be found" on [[Telegram (software)|Telegram]], Gab and [[Facebook]]. For example, "a user in a [[Three Percenters|Three Percenter]] Facebook group urged others to 'start slowly preparing now: food, ammo, fuel.'" Another user in a Three Percenter Facebook group "alleged that the left is using mail sorting machines to identify ballots for President Trump so that they can be discarded and replaced with a â€˜faked replacement ballot."<ref>{{Cite web|title=ADL Debunk: Election Edition|url=https://www.adl.org/adl-debunk-election-edition|access-date=2020-11-03|website=Anti-Defamation League|language=en}}</ref>
